conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on the small ball to find the electric field strength.
The image shows a small ball with mass m and charge q suspended by a string at an angle θ.
Identify the forces: gravitational force (mg), tension (T), and electric force (qE).
Resolve tension T into vertical (T cos θ) and horizontal (T sin θ) components.
Set up equilibrium conditions: net force in vertical and horizontal directions must be zero.
Vertical equilibrium: T cos θ = mg.
Horizontal equilibrium: T sin θ = qE.
Solve for T: T = mg / cos θ.
Substitute T into horizontal equation: (mg / cos θ) sin θ = qE.
Simplify to mg tan θ = qE.
Solve for E: E = (mg tan θ) / q.
